qas.question: Are attendance remittances that important to the Premier League?

answers.text: Stadium attendances are a significant source of regular income for Premier League clubs.

qas.question: What was the Premier Leagues standard attendance in the 2007-08 season?

answers.text: The Premier League's record average attendance of 36,144 was set during the 2007–08 season.

qas.question: What was the league's first year attendance average?

answers.text: the average attendance of 21,126 recorded in the league's first season (1992–93).

qas.question: Attendance for the 2013-14 season set a new record of how much?

answers.text: in the 2013–14 season recording an average attendance of 36,695 with a total attendance of just under 14 million,

What was the total attendance of all Premier League games during the 2009-10 season?

For when did the Taylor Report set the deadline for replacing terraces with seats in stadiums?

Stadium attendances provide what for the Taylor Report clubs?

What is the highest total in England's top flight since 1992?

context: <a0_0><b9_0>Stadium attendances<b9_0/> are a significant source of <b10_0>regular income<b10_0/> for Premier League clubs.<a0_0/> For the 2009–10 season, average attendances across the league clubs were <a4_0>34,215<a4_0/> for Premier League matches with a total aggregate attendance figure of <a5_0><b11_0>13,001,616<b11_0/><a5_0/>. This represents an increase of <a6_0>13,089<a6_0/> from <a2_0>the average attendance of 21,126 recorded in the league's first season (1992–93).<a2_0/> However, during the 1992–93 season the capacities of most stadiums were reduced as clubs replaced terraces with seats in order to meet the Taylor Report's <a7_0>1994–95<a7_0/> deadline for all-seater stadiums. <a1_0>The Premier League's record average attendance of 36,144 was set during the <a8_0>2007–08<a8_0/> season.<a1_0/> This record was then beaten <a3_0>in the <b12_0>2013–14<b12_0/> season recording an average attendance of 36,695 with a total attendance of <b13_0>just under 14 million<b13_0/>,<a3_0/> the highest average in England's top flight since 1950.
